page.title: 14ST THOMAS'S CH. & GLASS CH.
page.content: {St Thomas's church }is the main { {Catholic }church in Jersey.It was built in 1884 and renovated in 1983. It is called the {French Church } because mostly French people used it, and all the priests are French. Nowadays{French,English and Portugese} people use it. { {The Glass Church}(1842) is next to{ {Coronation Park}.It is unique because of the major 1930s renovation with {glass font} and {chancel}designed by { {Rene Lalique}..The church is not only glass - the floors are Portland stone and the walls are Bath stone.The glass work bears a lily which is the sign of purity. As you enter the church you see two beautiful lamps.On the door panels are two angels and there are two glass doors by the chancel.
